comments:
In the C/C++ project view I made a managed C project named hello.
When I click includes under the hello project in the C/C++ project view empty space is inserted and eclipse throws a nasty exception but keeps running.

This is with eclipse:

Version: 3.2.0
Build id: M20060629-1905

I noticed this with 3.1.1 first and this incident is 3.1.0

It might be something Linux specific.  I can't reproduce this on Windows on the latest from the 3.1.x branch with a hello world type Managed Build project.

From the stack trace I see a lot of NPEs happening all over the place... in the error parser threads, in the content provider for the CView, in the New Element Wizard (why that's even getting called I have no idea).  Something is definitely screwy to cause that much havoc.
You are using GCJ. Could you try the same with Sun JVM?

This works for me.   Since there has been no response from the originator, I am closing it  If you can reproduce this with a the JRE from SUN (or anything not GCJ), then feel free to re-open it.   Note that we have seen many problems with GCJ, especially with low memory conditions
